intro: Lasiodiscus pervillei, commonly known as the African violet. It is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa, characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, colorful flowers. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its compact growth habit. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Lasiodiscus pervillei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
